thread.title: Brittany Bowe wins 500m, 1500m at World Cup qualifier
thread.title_full: Brittany Bowe wins 500m, 1500m at World Cup qualifier

title: Brittany Bowe wins 500m, 1500m at World Cup qualifier
text:
Brittany Bowe wins 500m, 1500m at World Cup qualifier, Mitch Whitmore wins men's 500m Associated Press   9:16   9:16   
People: 
Men's sports (2326) 

SALT LAKE CITY â€” Olympian Brittany Bowe won the women's 500 meters in 37.67 seconds Saturday in on the second day of the U.S. Speedskating Long Track World Cup qualifier. 
Olympian Heather Richardson-Bergsma was second in 37.79, and Sugar Todd third in 38.25. 
Olympian Mitch Whitmore won the men's 500 in 34.67 and Jonathan Garcia turned in a personal best of 35.03 to finish second. Joey Mantia was third with a time of 35.72. 
Bowe also won the women's 1,500 with a time of 1:53.29, while Richardson-Bergsma was second, again, in 1:53.93. Paige Schwartzburg took third with a personal record of 1:58.96. 
Mantia crossed the line first in the men's 1,500 with a time of 1:43.71. Olympic champion Shani Davis was second in 1:45.28 and Kimani Griffin placed third in 1:48.82.
